page.title: 11Ecology
page.content: If you walked down by the R.Tyne today you would think it was very dirty and polluted.But it is a lot cleaner than it was 5 years ago.Before October 1980 there were 200 places where crude sewage could enter the river.Pollution in the water was causing the death of thousands of fish. The N.W.A. has built a Sewage Treatment Works at Howdon which treats sewage from both sides of the Tyne. The sludge which remains at the end of process is taken to an approved dumping ground 10 to 13 kilometres off shore by a sea-going sludge vessel. it is one of the most upto-date sewage system in Europe. Farms and Industrial storage areas are inspected to prevent pollutants being discharged into the river. Samples of the river water are taken to the laboratory at frequent intervals for
